data.title: The Queen and the Architect: Celebrating Maria Amalia of Saxony's Legacy

data.text:
Friday May 17, at 5:30 PM, in the Liani Hall of the Campano Museum, the second meeting of the project “The Queen and the Architect” is scheduled, created to celebrate the tricentennial of the birth of Queen Maria Amalia of Saxony.

The protagonists of this second meeting, titled “The pearls ... of Maria Amalia - The Bourbon jewelry of the '700”, will be the Bourbon jewels of the '700 with the public presentation of the pearl necklace and earrings of Queen Maria Amalia, expertly reproduced by Generoso De Sieno, master goldsmith and official supplier of the Royal House of Bourbon of the Two Sicilies. It will also still be possible to admire the exhibition of contemporary art curated by Claudia Mazzitelli, inaugurated in recent weeks when the volume “The Queen and the Architect” by Giuseppe De Nitto, published by Rivoluzioni Editoriali, was also presented.
